greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let n = 2^e_2 * 3^e_3 * 5^e_5 * ... be the prime factorization of n and let P(n) = A100549(n); then a(n) = Product_{ q <= P(n) } q^e_q; a(1) = 1 by convention.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..100000
maple: # First load the procedure pp from A100549
B := proc(n) local v,f,pv; global pp; option remember;
for f in op(2..-1,ifactors(n)) while f[1] <= pv do
mathematica: {1}~Join~Array[Function[{q, P}, Times @@ Power @@@ Select[q, First@# <= P &]] @@ {#, Prime@ PrimePi[1 + Max@ #[[All, -1]] ]} &@ FactorInteger[#] &, 96, 2] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 13 2018 *)
program: A100762(n) = if(1==n,1,my(u = A100549(n), f=factor(n)); prod(i=1, #f~, if(f[i, 1]<=u, f[i, 1]^f[i, 2], 1))); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 11 2018
results.author: _David Applegate_ and _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 15 2008
